body.p: To define default mappings between prefixes (that you can use in the XPath toolbar) and namespace URIs go to the XPath preferences page and enter the mappings in the Default prefix-namespace mappings table. The same preferences panel allows you to configure the default namespace used in XPath 2.0 expressions.
body.note: If you define a default namespace, binds this namespace to the first free prefix from the list: default, default1, default2, and so on. For example, if you define the default namespace xmlns="something" and the prefix default is not associated with another namespace, you can match tags without prefix in an XPath expression typed in the XPath toolbar by using the prefix default. To find all the level elements when you define a default namespace in the root element, use this expression: //default:level in the XPath toolbar.
